result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Otis Cordell Montgomery

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery not in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Otis Cordell Montgomery. Assistant District Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's appearance waived for the scheduling.  Defense is requesting a Daubert Hearing.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Motion hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Exclude DNA Expert Testimony, Filed.
Defendant's Discovery Demand RE: DNA, Filed.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Otis Cordell Montgomery.  Prosecuting attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's appearance waived.  This matter is adjourned in Br 45 for an additional scheduling.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Erin Karshen.  Parties before the Court for scheduling.  Discovery has been received, an offer letter has not been sent to defense.  Case is adjourned additional scheduling in Br 45.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Campos.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with HC 5/26/09

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Otis Cordell Montgomery in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Otis Cordell Montgomery appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
